data.title: Coins from Albania
data.meta_description: The monetary system of Albania is single-unit based and called, Lek (plural Leke). The coins reflect the country's cultural heritage and political history.
data.text:
Albania, a country located in southeastern Europe, has a long history of producing coins that reflect its cultural heritage and political influence. The earliest coins from Albania date back to ancient times, with the first coins being produced by the Illyrian tribe.

In the modern era, Albania began producing its own currency in the early 20th century, with the introduction of the lek in 1926. The first lek coins were made of silver and featured the image of King Zog I on the obverse side. The reverse side featured the image of an Albanian eagle, which has become a symbol of the country.

Over the years, Albania has produced a variety of coins with unique designs that reflect its culture and history. For example, the 1 lek coin issued in 1947 featured the image of a farmer holding a plough on one side and the Albanian eagle on the other. Similarly, the 10 lek coin issued in 1969 featured the image of the National Museum of History in Tirana on one side and the Albanian eagle on the other.

After the fall of communism in 1991, Albania began issuing new coins with updated designs that reflected its democratic government and economic reforms. In 1995, the country introduced a new series of coins with denominations ranging from 1 to 100 lek. The coins featured various images, such as a map of Albania, an eagle with its wings spread, and the image of Skanderbeg, a national hero who fought against the Ottoman Empire in the 15th century.

In recent years, Albania has also issued commemorative coins to celebrate various events and milestones in the country's history. For example, in 2018, the country issued a coin to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the proclamation of Albanian independence.

Albania's coins have also been recognized for their quality and design. In 2017, the country's 100 lek coin, which featured the image of an Albanian folk costume, was named the most beautiful coin of the year by the International Association of Currency Affairs.

In conclusion, Albania's coins reflect the country's rich cultural heritage and political history. From the ancient Illyrian coins to the modern lek, Albania has produced a variety of coins with unique designs that reflect its national pride and artistic heritage. With its production of commemorative coins and award-winning designs, Albania continues to be an important player in the world of numismatics.
